Package com.sdtech.stringextractor

Class XmlWriter

java.lang.Object
com.sdtech.stringextractor.XmlWriter
public class XmlWriter extends Object
The class for writting our generated xml into file.

This class open file in append mode by default. so even when the given file to StringExtractor as xmlFile contains other strings they can be merged without overwriting the file.

That means the file passed to this class constructor must be empty file, not exists before or valid strings xml file. otherwise the file may be improperly merged or currupted if not plain text file.

      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write(String name, String value) throws IOException
      Generate and append the string tag generated from the given name and value to file and save the file to avoid interruption before calling to save() or close() method.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the string to append to the file.
      value - The value of the string.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file is cannot be written to

    • save

      public void save() throws IOException
      save the code appended to the filewriter and close the writer.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an Error occur while closing or saving the file.

    • merge

      public void merge() throws IOException
      merge the original xml code inside file if available with new one to avoid xml passing error.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occured while reading from or writing to file when merging.

    • formatXml

      public void formatXml() throws IOException
      Formats and indent xml code created or merged.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exceotion occur while formatting.

    • isXmlFile

      public boolean isXmlFile(File xmlFile) throws IOException
      Check if the given file is exists and contains valid string xml code.

      if file is bigger than 2MB in size the negetive value will be returned even it is a valid xml file.

      Parameters:
      xmlFile - the File to check
      Returns:
      returns true if is valid xml file. false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occured while reading the file.

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Flush and close the writer.
      Throws:
      IOException - when an error occur while closing the writer.
